author: Callum Self
description:
What are the best Pokémon packs to buy in 2025? Every new era of the Pokémon TCG brings fresh expansions, and picking Pokémon booster packs to buy can be a headache for beginners and old hands alike. Fortunately, we’ve curated this list of the best Pokémon TCG packs money can buy in 2025, prioritizing the best chase cards, pull rates, and of course, the latest set to buy from.

If you need background info on any of our booster pack recommendations, our complete list of all Pokémon sets tracks every single release since 1996. And for the absolute crème de la Pokécrème, read our updated guide to the world's most expensive rare Pokémon cards.

Continue reading The best Pokémon packs to buy in 2025<
title: The best Pokémon packs to buy in 2025

author: Timothy Linward
description:
On September 26 and 27, academics from all around the world will meet online and in person at the University of Heidelberg for the second ever Warhammer conference. This global gathering might be the nerdiest activity ever to take place in Europe, as experts from multiple academic disciplines present their papers that connect Warhammer 40,000 and Age of Sigmar to their varied areas of study. If last year’s conference was a success, the follow-up suggests the idea has sticking power - and that’s important.

Continue reading The Warhammer 40k conference matters more than you think - here's why
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k game
title: The Warhammer 40k conference matters more than you think - here's why

author: Mollie Russell
description:
What are the best DnD games on PC and console? Many of them faithfully recreate the mechanics of the pen-and-paper game, but just as many get creative with the world's biggest fantasy RPG. We'd argue that D&D is best played in person with dice, but we have also spent thousands of hours on digital Dungeons and Dragons games - here are our top picks.

Continue reading Best DnD games on PC in 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: Best DnD games on PC in 2025

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Understandably, the board game community is pumped for Brass: Pittsburgh. The successor to a line of ultra-successful strategy titles, Pittsburgh will innovate on what’s widely considered the most acclaimed board game of all time. We won’t see a wink of it until 2026, though. If you’re looking to fill a Brass-shaped hole in your life until then, I’d seriously recommend Skyrise.

Continue reading Can't wait for Brass Pittsburgh? Try the designer's latest tactical board game
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Can't wait for Brass Pittsburgh? Try the designer's latest tactical board game

author: Matt Bassil
description:
What is the current MTG release schedule? This guide tracks all of the upcoming MTG releases in 2025 and 2026, including release dates, mechanics, and story details. From space travel to Spiderman, there’s a lot to look forward to this year. We're revisiting a fan-favorite plane, exploring a new one for the first time, and - love 'em or hate 'em - there are a lot of Universes Beyond crossovers coming out too.

Continue reading Magic: The Gathering release schedule 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Magic: The Gathering release schedule 2025

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Bad luck for Pokémon card fans in Europe, the Middle East or Asia, the upcoming TCG release Mega Evolution has been delayed until October 10, two weeks past the expected release date of September 26.

Continue reading Pokémon's Mega Evolution set delayed by two weeks outside of America
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: Pokémon's Mega Evolution set delayed by two weeks outside of America

author: Mollie Russell
description:
The War Caster feat saw a tiny wording tweak in DnD’s 2024 rules, and this has recently triggered a debate across the most popular D&D YouTube channels. Designers Makenzie De Armas and Justice Arman have put the debate to bed, though, appearing in a Dungeon Dudes video on August 26 to make an official ruling on whether War Caster can be ‘exploited’ to buff your allies.

Continue reading DnD designers settle War Caster 'exploit' debate once and for all
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: DnD designers settle War Caster 'exploit' debate once and for all

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Magic: The Gathering card Winged Hive Tyrant has seen a pretty neat little price bump, jumping from the cheap and cheerful $0.80 one month ago to $3.60 today. Surge foils have gotten even more pricey. In early July, this variant of the card was selling for $1-2, but now it’s fetching $15-20 on TCGPlayer.

Continue reading Tyranid MTG card spikes 350% thanks to unlikely team up with Sonic the Hedgehog
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Tyranid MTG card spikes 350% thanks to unlikely team up with Sonic the Hedgehog

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Raptor Ruckus is a new indie tabletop RPG set on a (legally distinct) dinosaur amusement park where “the fences are down, the power's out, and you're back at the bottom of the food chain”, currently crowdfunding on Kickstarter. With rules adapted from Mörk Borg’s quick playing d20 system, it promises “survival horror by way of Dinosaurs circa 1993”.

Continue reading Indie tabletop RPG Mörk Borg gets an ultra-silly Jurassic Park inspired spin-off
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best tabletop RPGs, Best horror TTRPGs, D&D classes guide
title: Indie tabletop RPG Mörk Borg gets an ultra-silly Jurassic Park inspired spin-off
